001package Filters;
002import java.util.Random;
003
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
006import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
007
008/**
009 * Simple version of the Jitter filter. Works for all image types
010 * but does not handle image borders.
011 * The input image is destructively modified.
012 * 
013 * @author wilbur
014 * @version 2016/11/01
015 */
016public class Jitter_Filter_Simple implements PlugInFilter {
017        
018        int rad = 3;    // the radius (should be user-specified)
019                
020        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
021                return DOES_ALL;
022        }
023
024        public void run(ImageProcessor ip1) {
025                final int w = ip1.getWidth();
026                final int h = ip1.getHeight();
027                
028                Random rnd = new Random();
029                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip1.duplicate();
030                
031                final int d = 2 * rad + 1;      // width/height of the "kernel"
032                
033                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
034                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
035                                int rx = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
036                                int ry = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
037                                // pick a random position inside the current support region
038                                int p = ip2.getPixel(u + rx, v + ry);
039                                // replace the current center pixel
040                                ip1.putPixel(u, v, p);
041                        }
042                }
043        }
044        
045}
